intro: Geissorhiza radians, commonly known as the golden rain lily, is a striking flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has strap-shaped, grass-like leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value and ease of cultivation have made it a favored plant in horticulture.
